PortalInstall.5q0aajl77lg32: Note: Third-party tools refer to the confluent tools (including the Kafka zookeeper schemaRegistry) in the portal, which can be bound to the confluent tools installed on other portals for data migration, and the current portal can be reinstalled to migrate data
PortalInstall.suiteInfoContent: To use the data migration feature, you need to install the migration suite portal. The portal is the execution program for migrations. A server that successfully installs the portal becomes a migration executor, responsible for executing migration tasks.
PortalInstall.systemInfoContent: Currently, the portal only supports installation on specific systems and architectures. Supported system architectures include: CentOS 7 x86_64, openEuler 2003 x86_64/aarch64, openEuler 2203 x86_64/aarch64.
PortalInstall.softwareContent: For the portal to run, it requires certain software packages on the server, including: python-devel, python3-devel, mariadb-devel (or mysql-devel or mysql5-devel). It is recommended to refer to the following "Dependency Installation Instructions" for installation.
PortalInstall.dependenceContent: To ensure installation stability, the required dependencies are already packaged within the portal installation package. When installing the portal, simply grant the portal installation user sudo passwordless permissions, and the dependencies will be installed along with the portal.
PortalInstall.sudoContent: Sudo permissions are only needed for installing the portal dependencies. If the portal dependencies have already been installed on the server, the installation user does not need sudo permissions to directly install the portal. Additionally, the portal does not require sudo permissions during operation. Therefore, please manage sudo permissions properly.
PortalInstall.sudoRemind: Non-essential permissions. Please manage these permissions appropriately.
PortalInstall.tempSudoRemind: To install portal dependencies, temporarily enable sudo passwordless permissions for the user.

index.offlineMsg: Offline mode: Automatically perform full migration and end automatically after completion to release resources.
index.onlineMsg: Online mode: Full migration + incremental migration is automatically performed, and the reverse migration is manually started by the user. User operations are required to end the migration and release resources.
index.adjustMsg: Adjusting kernel parameters with the aim of improving migration efficiency; Only when the database migration user is an administrator can this be checked.
index.defaultMsg: Each migration process requires parameter configuration. Datakit has configured default parameters for each migration process (i.e., subtask).
index.customMsg: You can customize the parameter configuration for migration processes (i.e., subtasks) to ensure smooth migration.

index.dbTypeContent: The parentheses indicate which mainstream database's SQL syntax and statement behavior the control database is compatible with. A indicates compatibility with O database. B indicates compatibility with MY database. C indicates compatibility with TD database. PG indicates compatibility with POSTGRES database. D indicates compatibility with S database.

index.5q093f8y7g00: Tip: DataKit tries to execute subtasks in parallel based on the principle of maximizing resource utilization, creates a data migration agent for each subtask (one machine can create multiple migration agents), and waits for resources to execute sequentially when resources are insufficient.
